detaileddescription.para: Signals downstream the symbol index and (if necessary) resynching.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the channel taps based on pilots. This is the linear very simple implementation.
Calculates the channel taps at the SPs, given the input complex baseband signal and a symbol number (between 0 and 3). The method that integer frequency offset has been corrected.

detaileddescription.para: Estimates the current symbol. Necessary for equalization.
Given a fft_size (i.e. a mode), this method assigns an array where the position of the tmcc and ac pilots are indicated.
Given a carrier index, this method returns the value that a pilot would have in such position.
This method constructs the pseudo-random sequence wk used by the standard.

briefdescription.para: This method is responsible for the integer frequency error estimation.
It calculate the FFT of in and saves it on out. Note that the fft_size is assumed given by d_fft_length.

memberdef.argsstring: (const gr_complex *in, int lookup_start, int lookup_stop, int *cp_pos, float *peak_epsilon)
memberdef.name: ml_sync

briefdescription.para: Calculates the likelihood function, and outputs the position of its maximum.

detaileddescription.para: Given the input, it calculates the resulting likelihood function between indices lookup_stop and lookup_start. It returns the beginning of the CP (in cp_pos), and an the value of epsilon (see the paper). to_consume and to_out was used as indicators of whether the peak was correctly found or not. Now the return value is used (either true or false).

briefdescription.para: Initializes the parameters used in the peak_detect_process.

parameterdescription.para: The algorithm keeps an average of minimum and maximum value. A peak is considered valid when it's bigger than avg_max - threshold_factor_rise(avg_max-avg_min).
The parameter used to update both the average maximum and minimum (exponential filter, or single-root iir).

briefdescription.para: Given datain and its length, the method return the peak position and its value in the form of an array (for "historical" reasons, since it's always a single value).
Sends a tag downstream that signals that acquisition was successfully performed (or that we lost synchronization and we have regained it).
Using the vector derot calculated by ml_sync (an exponential modulated with minus the estimated frequency error), this method simply multiplies it by the input and saves it in the output.
